storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect scheduling conflicts in real-time to avoid double bookings

testCases.title: Validate conflict detection for overlapping events
preconditions: User is authenticated and logged into the scheduling system
User has permission to create and schedule events
Event database is accessible and operational
No existing events are scheduled in the 10:00-12:00 time slot
System conflict detection feature is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and select 'Create New Event'
steps.expectedResult: Event creation form is displayed with all required fields (title, start time, end time, participants)

steps.action: Enter event details: Title='Meeting A', Start Time='10:00', End Time='11:00', and click 'Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: Event 'Meeting A' is scheduled successfully and appears in the calendar view for the 10:00-11:00 time slot

steps.action: Verify the first event is saved by refreshing the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Event 'Meeting A' remains visible in the calendar at 10:00-11:00 time slot

steps.action: Click 'Create New Event' again to schedule a second event
steps.expectedResult: Event creation form is displayed again with empty fields ready for new input

steps.action: Enter event details: Title='Meeting B', Start Time='10:30', End Time='11:30', and click 'Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: System detects the overlap between 10:30-11:00 with existing 'Meeting A' and prevents immediate scheduling

steps.action: Check for conflict alert notification on the screen
steps.expectedResult: User receives a conflict alert notification within 2 seconds indicating overlap with 'Meeting A' from 10:30 to 11:00

steps.action: Review the conflict details displayed in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows both conflicting events with their time slots: 'Meeting A (10:00-11:00)' and 'Meeting B (10:30-11:30)' with the overlapping period highlighted

steps.action: Verify that 'Meeting B' was not added to the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Only 'Meeting A' appears in the calendar; 'Meeting B' is not scheduled

postconditions: Only the first event 'Meeting A' (10:00-11:00) remains scheduled in the system
The second event 'Meeting B' is not saved to the database
Conflict alert has been displayed to the user
User can modify the second event time to resolve the conflict
System remains in a consistent state ready for next scheduling action

testCases.title: Ensure no conflict detection for non-overlapping events
preconditions: User is authenticated and logged into the scheduling system
User has permission to create and schedule events
Event database is accessible and operational
No existing events are scheduled in the 10:00-13:00 time slot
System conflict detection feature is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and select 'Create New Event'
steps.expectedResult: Event creation form is displayed with all required fields (title, start time, end time, participants)

steps.action: Enter event details: Title='Meeting A', Start Time='10:00', End Time='11:00', and click 'Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: Event 'Meeting A' is scheduled successfully without any conflict alerts and appears in the calendar view for the 10:00-11:00 time slot

steps.action: Verify the first event is saved by checking the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Event 'Meeting A' is visible in the calendar at 10:00-11:00 time slot with confirmed status

steps.action: Click 'Create New Event' to schedule a second event immediately after the first
steps.expectedResult: Event creation form is displayed again with empty fields ready for new input

steps.action: Enter event details: Title='Meeting B', Start Time='11:00', End Time='12:00', and click 'Schedule'
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and completes the conflict check within 2 seconds without detecting any overlap

steps.action: Verify that 'Meeting B' is scheduled successfully
steps.expectedResult: Event 'Meeting B' is scheduled successfully and appears in the calendar view for the 11:00-12:00 time slot immediately following 'Meeting A'

steps.action: Check for any conflict alert notifications on the screen or notification panel
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alert is displayed; user does not receive any conflict notification

steps.action: Verify both events are visible in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Both 'Meeting A' (10:00-11:00) and 'Meeting B' (11:00-12:00) are displayed consecutively in the calendar without any conflict indicators

steps.action: Check the event database or event list to confirm both events are saved
steps.expectedResult: Both events are successfully saved in the system with correct time slots and no conflict flags

postconditions: Both events 'Meeting A' (10:00-11:00) and 'Meeting B' (11:00-12:00) are successfully scheduled in the system
No conflict alerts were generated during the scheduling process
Both events are saved to the database with active status
Calendar displays both events consecutively without overlap
System is ready to accept additional scheduling requests
